name: BBCWorld
text:

name: BBCWorld
text:

name: BBCWorld
text:

name: BBCWorld
text:
RT @BBCWorld: Scientists think there could be as much as 21 million tonnes of tiny plastic fragments floating in the Atlantic Ocean

Twenty-one million tonnes of plastic would be enough to fully load almost 1,000 container ships

[Thread]
 
https://t.co/0rg9KtwOoj

name: BBCWorld
text:
Anti-corruption campaigner Alexei Navalny is unconscious in hospital with suspected poisoning, his spokeswoman says

He has long been the most prominent face of Russian opposition to President Putin, calling his party a place of "crooks and thieves"

https://t.co/M44PBTAFGa

name: BBCWorld
text:
RT @bbcworldservice: In Japan, "evaporated people" choose to vanish from their own lives to start a new one somewhere else.

These are the stories of some of them ‚Äì and the people they've left behind. Hear more in our Rulebreakers series: https://t.co/xnpYx6u68P https://t.co/D4OlWOUi92

name: BBCWorld
text:
US state of Michigan 'agrees to pay $600m (¬£460m)' to victims of Flint water crisis, which left at least 12 dead and exposed tens of thousands of children to lead poisoning

https://t.co/QdhXSAjg16

text:
